fact_list.fact_text: A good driver should read and adjust speed according to road conditions, such as road width, surface type, contour, and potential hazards.
On sandy or pebbled surfaces, there is a greater risk of side slipping.
Avoid hard acceleration, braking, and sudden sharp turning on sandy or pebbled surfaces.
If the rear of your vehicle skids sideways, immediately remove your foot from the accelerator.
During skid correction, never apply the brakes and steer in the direction of the skid.
On roads with uneven surfaces, drive slowly.
When encountering large potholes, reduce speed further and proceed slowly.
When driving around a bend or sharp corner at high speed, your vehicle is pushed out of its travel path by Centrifugal Force.
The greater the travelling speed around a curve or the sharper the curve, the more the vehicle is pushed from its path.
Reduce speed when going around a bend.
